The AIM/CGE model is a recursive-dynamic general equilibrium model that covers all regions worldwide. Details of the model structure and mathematical formulas are provided by Fujimori et al.
16, 17 . The main inputs of the AIM/CGE are population, GDP, food preferences, assumptions of energy technology progress on both the supply and demand sides, and air pollution control level. The model provides energy consumption, agricultural and land-use indicators, and GHG and AP emissions. The AIM/CGE considers CO 2, CH 4, N 2O, and fluorine gas to be GHGs, while black carbon (BC), carbon monoxide (CO), ammonia (NH 3), non-methane volatile organic compounds (VOCs), mono-nitrogen oxides (NO X), organic carbon (OC), and sulphur oxides (SO X) are treated as APs.
